intro: Arabidopsis russelliana, commonly known as Russell's thale cress, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant has simple, alternate leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its genome has been studied as a model organism in plant genetics research.
